info.name: Cisco Business Dashboard API Samples
info.description: Sample requests demonstrating the use of the Cisco Business Dashboard API.

item.name: Generate JWT using the RSA-Sign Crypto Library

exec: var navigator = {}; //fake a navigator object for the lib
var window = {}; //fake a window object for the lib
var sJWT = KJUR.jws.JWS.sign("HS256", sHeader, sPayload, secret);

request.description:
Load the RSA-Sign Crypto LIbrary in a global environment variable.  Calculate a JWT using environment parameters and store the result in an environment variable.

Source: http://kjur.github.io/jsrsasign/jsrsasign-latest-all-min.js

Github: https://github.com/kjur/jsrsasign

This approach is derived from the methods described in https://medium.com/adobetech/using-postman-for-jwt-authentication-on-adobe-i-o-7573428ffe7f.
Returns a JSON list of all organizations defined on the target system.

exec: // Check to see if orgid is defined in the environment, and if present, add
// the x-ctx-org-id header to restrict the results to only that organization.

request.description: Returns a JSON list of all networks defined on the target system.  If an organization ID is defined in the environment, then restrict the results.

exec: // Check to see if orgid is defined in the environment, and if present, add
// the x-ctx-org-id header to restrict the results to only that organization.

query.description: Networks returned will contain this string
Only return the network name and ID fields

request.description: Returns a JSON list of all networks defined on the target system that match the specified search string.  The search string should be set as a query parameter.  If an organization ID is defined in the environment, then restrict the results to only that organization.

exec: // Check to see if orgid is defined in the environment, and if not, throw an error
throw new Error('An organization ID must be specified in the orgid environment variable.')

request.description: Add a new network with details as specified in the payload.  Before sending this request, the payload should be updated with details appropriate for the environment.  Network will be added to the organization corresponding to the orgid set in the environment.

exec: // Check to see if orgid is defined in the environment, and if present, add
// the x-ctx-org-id header to restrict the results to only that organization.

query.description: Networks returned will contain this string
Note: some additional fields such as network and organization will always be returned
Allowed values: All, Device, Others, Router, Switch, WAP, IpPhone, IpCamera, NAS, VirtualDevice, or WLC.  May be specified multiple times.

request.description: Returns a JSON list of all devices defined on the target system that match the specified search string and type(s).  The search string and type values should be set as query parameters.  If an organization ID is defined in the environment, then restrict the results to only that organization.

Create a backup configuration job for a device.  The ID of the device to back up will be taken from the deviceid environment variable, or you can update the body directly to contain a list of one or more device IDs as string values.  The body also contains a comment that will be attached to the backup.

Create a reboot job for a device.  The ID of the device to reboot will be taken from the deviceid environment variable, or you can update the body directly to contain a list of one or more device IDs as string values.

Sets up a x-launch session for the specified device.  The ID of the device is taken from the deviceid environment variable.  The x-launch session is only available from the IP address that initiates the request.

Note: The behaviour of this request varies depending on the Postman setting 'Automatically follow redirects'.  If the setting is enabled (default), the response body will contain the page returned by the target device when the root URL is requested.  If the setting is disabled, then the response is a 302 Found with the URL of the next page to be requested in the Location header.

request.description: Returns a JSON list of all device groups defined on the target system.  If an organization ID is defined in the environment, then restrict the results.

body.raw:
{
  "device-name":"Device_Hostname",
  "node-type":"Allowed values: Router, Switch, WAP",
  "pid":"Product ID - e.g. SG350-10P",
  "sn":"Serial Number - 11 alphanumeric characters",
  "group-id":"ID of device group",
  "network-id":"ID of network",
  "image-id":"ID of PnP image file.  May be blank.",
  "config-id":"ID of PnP config file.  May be blank."
}

request.description: Add a new PnP device with details as specified in the payload.  Before sending this request, the payload should be updated with details appropriate for the device to be created.
